What is Python?: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity, readability, and extensive libraries that support a wide range of applications such as web development, data analysis, and artificial intelligence.
What is JavaScript?: JavaScript is a versatile and powerful programming language primarily used for creating interactive and dynamic user interfaces in web development, as well as server-side applications using environments like Node.js.
What is Angular?: Angular is a robust and widely-used framework for building single-page web applications. It provides tools like two-way data binding, dependency injection, and component-based architecture to streamline development.
What is Node.js?: Node.js is a runtime environment that allows developers to run JavaScript on the server side, enabling the creation of scalable, high-performance, and event-driven applications.
What is HTML?: HTML, or HyperText Markup Language, is the standard language for creating the structure and layout of web pages. It forms the backbone of all websites by organizing content into elements like headings, paragraphs, and links.
What is CSS?: CSS, or Cascading Style Sheets, is a styling language used to control the presentation of web pages, including colors, fonts, layouts, and responsive design for various screen sizes.
What is SQL?: SQL, or Structured Query Language, is a domain-specific language designed for managing and manipulating relational databases. It is widely used for querying, updating, and maintaining data integrity.
What is MongoDB?: MongoDB is a NoSQL, document-oriented database known for its flexibility and scalability. It stores data in JSON-like formats and is often used for applications that require a dynamic schema.
What is Spring Boot?: Spring Boot is a Java-based framework that simplifies the development of stand-alone, production-ready applications. It offers pre-configured setups and extensive support for microservices architectures.
What is REST API?: A REST API is an application programming interface that follows the principles of Representational State Transfer, enabling seamless communication between systems using standard HTTP methods.
What is JSON?: JSON, or JavaScript Object Notation, is a lightweight and human-readable data format commonly used for transferring data between a server and a client in web applications.
What is TypeScript?: TypeScript is a statically typed superset of JavaScript that enhances code quality and developer productivity by providing features like type annotations, interfaces, and advanced tooling.
What is Bootstrap?: Bootstrap is a front-end framework that helps developers create responsive, mobile-first websites. It includes pre-designed components, a grid system, and powerful utilities for styling and layout.
What is Git?: Git is a distributed version control system that tracks changes in source code, allowing developers to collaborate efficiently and manage their projects with features like branching and merging.
What is GitHub?: GitHub is a cloud-based platform that hosts Git repositories and provides collaboration tools, such as pull requests and code reviews, for teams to work on shared codebases.
What is Redux?: Redux is a predictable state management library for JavaScript applications, often used with React. It centralizes application state, making debugging and testing more straightforward.
What is jQuery?: jQuery is a fast, lightweight JavaScript library that simplifies DOM manipulation, event handling, animations, and Ajax interactions, reducing the amount of code developers need to write.
What is Agile?: Agile is a collaborative and iterative software development methodology that prioritizes flexibility, customer feedback, and delivering incremental value throughout the development process.
What is DevOps?: DevOps is a set of practices and tools that combine software development and IT operations to shorten the development lifecycle and deliver high-quality software faster and more reliably.
What is Docker?: Docker is a containerization platform that packages applications and their dependencies into containers, ensuring they run consistently across different computing environments.
What is Kubernetes?: Kubernetes is an open-source orchestration platform designed to automate the deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications across clusters of machines.
What is AWS?: AWS, or Amazon Web Services, is a comprehensive cloud platform that provides a wide range of services for computing, storage, databases, machine learning, and more.
What is Azure?: Azure is Microsoft's cloud computing platform that offers services such as virtual machines, databases, artificial intelligence, and analytics for businesses and developers.
What is React Native?: React Native is an open-source framework that allows developers to build cross-platform mobile applications using JavaScript and React, offering near-native performance.
What is Flutter?: Flutter is a UI toolkit developed by Google for creating natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase, using the Dart programming language.
What is TensorFlow?: TensorFlow is an open-source library developed by Google for numerical computation and machine learning. It supports deep learning and other AI-related tasks.
What is Pandas?: Pandas is a Python library that provides data structures like DataFrames and Series for efficient data manipulation, cleaning, and analysis in tabular formats.
What is NumPy?: NumPy is a Python library used for numerical computations. It provides support for multi-dimensional arrays and mathematical operations like linear algebra and statistics.
What is Matplotlib?: Matplotlib is a Python library for data visualization, allowing developers to create static, interactive, and animated plots to represent data graphically.
What is Scikit-learn?: Scikit-learn is a machine learning library in Python that provides tools for classification, regression, clustering, and preprocessing with efficient implementations of algorithms.
What is Tableau?: Tableau is a powerful data visualization tool used for creating interactive dashboards and reports, helping users gain insights from their data effectively.
What is Power BI?: Power BI is a business analytics service by Microsoft that enables users to create interactive reports, share insights, and visualize data from various sources.
What is CI/CD?: CI/CD refers to Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment practices that automate testing and deployment, ensuring faster and more reliable software delivery pipelines.
What is Selenium?: Selenium is an open-source framework for automating web browser interactions, widely used for testing web applications across different browsers and platforms.
What is JIRA?: JIRA is a project management and issue-tracking tool used by agile teams to plan, track, and manage software development and other project workflows.
What is Webpack?: Webpack is a module bundler for JavaScript applications. It compiles multiple files and dependencies into a single bundle, optimizing performance for web applications.
What is Apache Kafka?: Apache Kafka is a distributed streaming platform used for building real-time data pipelines and streaming applications. It efficiently handles large volumes of data.
What is ELK Stack?: The ELK Stack, consisting of Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana, is a suite of tools used for log management, data analytics, and visualization in real-time.
What is Terraform?: Terraform is an open-source infrastructure as code tool that enables developers to define and provision data center infrastructure using configuration files.
